result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L Everson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will maintain absolute sobriety.

DE will provide a DNA sample/pay surcharge and domestic abuse surcharge on each count.

DE will complete and AODA assessment and any follow up recommended.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Daniel L Everson in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Defendant Daniel L Everson in custody.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court has colloquy with DE on possible conflict with DA, no conflict found.   Court recites case settlement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 2,3.  Ct 1 will be DRI. Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE enters plea's of NC, court will accept and find the DE G.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will order sentence withheld, 2 years probation, AODA assessment/followup, maintain absolute sobriety, CC,DNA sample-surcharge, rest in the amount of $324.00 , DOM assessment in each count, 2 days credit.
